t: Ezekiel 30
A Lament for Egypt
The*p word of the Lord*s came to me:
“Son of man, prophesy, and say, Thus says the Lord God:*s “Wail,*pn ‘Alas for the day!’
For*ld the day is near, the*ld day of the Lord*s is near; it*ln will be a day of clouds, a*ld time of doom for the nations.
A*ln sword shall come upon Egypt, and*ld anguish shall be in Cush, when*ln the slain fall in Egypt, and*ld her wealth is carried away, and*ld her foundations are torn down.
Cush,*p and Put, and Lud, and all Arabia, and Libya, and the people of the land that is in league, shall fall with them by the sword.

“Thus*pn says the Lord:*s Those*ln who support Egypt shall fall, and*ld her proud might shall come down; from*ln Migdol to Syene they*ld shall fall within her by the sword, declares*ln the Lord God.*s
And*ln they shall be desolated in the midst of desolated countries, and*ld their cities shall be in the midst of cities that are laid waste.
Then*ln they will know that I am the Lord,*s when*ld I have set fire to Egypt, and*ld all her helpers are broken.
“On*p that day messengers shall go out from me in ships to terrify the unsuspecting people of Cush, and anguish shall come upon them on the day of Egypt’s doom; for, behold, it comes!
“Thus*p says the Lord God:*s “I*pn will put an end to the wealth of Egypt, by*ld the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.
He*ln and his people with him, the most ruthless of nations, shall*ld be brought in to destroy the land, and*ln they shall draw their swords against Egypt and*ld fill the land with the slain.

And*ln I will dry up the Nile and*ld will sell the land into the hand of evildoers; I*ln will bring desolation upon the land and everything in it, by*ld the hand of foreigners; I*ln am the Lord;*s I have spoken.

“Thus*p says the Lord God:*s “I*pn will destroy the idols and*ld put an end to the images in Memphis; there*ln shall no longer be a prince from the land of Egypt; so*ld I will put fear in the land of Egypt.
I*ln will make Pathros a desolation and*ld will set fire to Zoan and*ld will execute judgments on Thebes.
And*ln I will pour out my wrath on Pelusium, the*ld stronghold of Egypt, and*ld cut off the multitude of Thebes.
And*ln I will set fire to Egypt; Pelusium*ld shall be in great agony; Thebes*ln shall be breached, and*ld Memphis shall face enemies by day.
The*ln young men of On and of Pi-beseth shall fall by the sword, and*ld the women shall go into captivity.

At*ln Tehaphnehes the day shall be dark, when*ld I break there the yoke bars of Egypt, and*ln her proud might shall come to an end in her; she*ld shall be covered by a cloud, and*ld her daughters shall go into captivity.
Thus*ln I will execute judgments on Egypt. Then*ld they will know that I am the Lord.”*s
Egypt Shall Fall to Babylon
In*p the eleventh year, in the first month, on the seventh day of the month, the word of the Lord*s came to me:
“Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and behold, it has not been bound up, to heal it by binding it with a bandage, so that it may become strong to wield the sword.
Therefore thus says the Lord God:*s Behold, I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt and will break his arms, both the strong arm and the one that was broken, and I will make the sword fall from his hand.
I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them through the countries.
And I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon and put my sword in his hand, but I will break the arms of Pharaoh, and he will groan before him like a man mortally wounded.

I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, but the arms of Pharaoh shall fall. Then they shall know that I am the Lord,*s when I put my sword into the hand of the king of Babylon and he stretches it out against the land of Egypt.
And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout the countries. Then they will know that I am the Lord.”*s
